page.title: 20CUSTOMS AT COMMONSIDE
page.content:
A SERVICE IS HELD IN TEVIOTHEAD CHURCH AND A PILGRIMAGE IS MADE ANNUALLY BY THE BRETHERN OF{THE MASONIC {LODGES}OF HAWICK AND{SAINT DAVID'S EDINBURGH,TO THE COTTAGE AND CAIRN ON DRYDEN KNOWES ERECTED 1874.THIS IS IN MEMORY OF HENRY SCOTT RIDDELL ONE TIME SHEPHERD AND THEN MINISTER AT TEVIOTHEAD CHURCH,MASTER MASON AND AUTHOR OF THE NATIONAL SONG'SCOTLAND YET'AND OTHER WORKS.AFTERWARDS TEA IS SERVED TO ALL IN TEVIOTHEAD VILLAGE HALL.
THANKS TO THREE MEMBERS OF THE NEWMILL & TEVIOTHEAD WRI, THESE RECORDS HAVE BEEN COMPILED. THANKS TO THE DOMESDAY PROJECT THREE MORE PEOPLE HAVE MORE OF AN INKLING AS TO THE GOINGS-ON OF COMPUTERS!
